p: The computational design of new proteins sparks hopes in the field of rational vaccinology, particularly to elicit targeted neutralizing antibody responses (Correia et al. 2014; Sesterhenn et al. 2019). While most de novo proteins designed so far are either functionless or present functions that are encoded by regular, continuous secondary structures. Interestingly, a great progress has been made recently by Sesterhenn et al., who developed a novel computational design strategy to build de novo proteins presenting complex structural motifs (Sesterhenn et al. 2020). By using this strategy, the authors further engineered epitope-focused immunogens mimicking irregular and discontinuous RSV neutralization epitopes. And excitingly, the de novoâ€“designed immunogens can induce robust neutralizing responses against the respiratory syncytial virus in both mice and nonhuman primates (Sesterhenn et al. 2020).
